Key Arguments: Concerns about freedom of speech and the decision-making process for controlling misinformation.
Skepticism about the qualifications and impartiality of ACMA staff and any appointed panels.
Doubt about the ability to ensure unbiased review panels and the independence of ACMA from government influence.
Criticism of government trustworthiness based on past behavior during the Covid pandemic.
Belief that the legislation is a tool for the government to suppress dissenting voices.
Notable Quotes: Surely, you’re not suggesting that unelected, untrained, poorly educated, maybe poorly literate public servants (i.e., ACMA staff) will make decisions...
Seeing that governments of all persuasions couldn’t... be trusted to supply honest information during Covid, why would we even be contemplating giving a government department the final say?
Blind Freddy can see that this is a ploy to put the rule of law behind government moves to de-platform and cancel its critics...
